basic.description:
Part 3 of a 12-16 month, professionally supervised, career-related position designed to offer students the opportunity to learn about current advances, practices, and technologies in workplaces including business, industry, government, and community settings. Students will develop a range of workplace skills, learn about organizational culture, expand their knowledge of career options, and reflect on linkages between classroom knowledge and professional practice.
NOTE    Students enroll in INTN 301/1.5 in the first term of the internship, INTN 302/1.5 in the second term of the internship, and INTN 303/3.0 in the final term(s) of the internship, for a total of 6.0 units.
basic.subject: INTN
basic.title: Professional Internship lll
